intro: Paepalanthus glareosus, commonly known as the silverleaf cactus, is a species native to South America, particularly found in the Andean regions of Peru and Bolivia. It is a low-growing, sprawling cactus with a distinctive silver-green coloration due to its dense covering of fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a striking contrast to its foliage. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring minimal water and well-draining soil. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens and rockeries.
